taskbody.context: In this topic you will create two concept topics based on templates already provided. You will be working in the DITASAMPLE_GROCERY_SOURCE directory. This topic assumes you are familiar with the information in About the grocery shopping sample.

step.cmd: Copy the about_cannedgoods.dita file to the "working" directory (working/concepts).
Using your authoring tool, open the "working" version of about_cannedgoods.dita.
In the prolog section, change the text of the author element text to your name, the copyrholder element text to your company name, and the revised element text to the current date.
In the conbody section, add a paragraph element with some text about canned goods, and an unordered list with some reasons for buying canned goods.
step.info:
Here is a suggestion:

Canned goods are easy-to-use and easy-to-store staples in most kitchens. Common canned goods available in almost any grocery store are beans, canned vegetables, and canned fruits.

You can save money on canned goods by:

  • buying from chain or discount grocery stores
  • buying larger cans

step.cmd: If you have problems creating or validating your working file, compare it with the file by the same name in the completed directory.
Go back to the template/concepts directory.
Copy the about_produce.dita file to the "working" directory (working/concepts).
Using your authoring tool, open the "working" version of about_produce.dita.
Edit the same prolog elements you did in the about_cannedgoods.dita file.
In the conbody section of about_produce.dita, add a paragraph element with some text about produce.
step.info:
Here is a suggestion:

One of the keys to good health is eating lots of produce. It pays to buy fresh fruits and vegetables and serve them often.

You can save money by buying produce when it is in season.
